Articles.Content: Been looking to try and solve this, I am trying to put together a simple large lander that can pull a similar lander design to Minmus. The landers are made of the lander can and a large fuel tank with the docking ports on the tops of the land cans. Once I dock them I have a horrible time trying to get it to fly with ASAS wobbling the heck outta it, I know this is a huge problem with stations but I need this thing to fly. I can turn it off but its pretty hard to burn to a planet with this off. Anyways I was trying to figure out what is the best way to solve this issue so I can properly fly docked ships

Install the mod Quantum Struts, and place them so they will hold the ships together once they dock if your ok with mods.

If not, the multi-port system will have to do for you! Look at the link under my post, and watch the very first video for instructions

QS is way better than the multi-port system. Often you will get one dock and the other refuses to dock which makes it even more unstable. With QS you can even toggle them on and off with action groups. They make the very weak docking connectors a lot stronger.
Awesome, thank you guys so much for the fast replies! I do not mind mods at all and look forward to trying both of these tonight.
You can fix this without modifiers being installed, although it is somewhat cheating you just use time acceleration and it stops all craft movement other than orbit.
That doesn't work when trying to move the ships. Not at all. And physics warp will exacerbate the issue!!
